\num{3} (yAvudaradeV) hiMBAga; hiMbadi: \eng{back of a car} kArina hiMBAga. \eng{back of leg} kAlina hiMbadi. 
\num{4} (yAvudaradeV hecucx baLasada, kANada, \mo) pakakx, BAga, magugxlu: \eng{back of hand} hiMgeY; keYya hiMBAga; karapaqSaThx. \eng{back of knife} cAkuvina hiMbadi; haritavAgirada, katatxrisuva aMcige virudadhx dikikxnalilxruva pakakx. \eng{back of carpet} hAsina taLamagugxlu. 
\num{5} (pArxNigaLa) benunx; beMbadi; ede hoTeTxgaLa hiMBAga. 
\num{6} (beTaTx, haDagu, \mo vugaLa) benunx yA benunx mULeyaMtiruva BAga: \eng{back of hill} beTaTxda benunx. 
\numi{7} (PuTfbAlf \mo\ ATagaLalilx) bAYxkf: 
\banum
\alnum{a} goVlina muMdugaDeya oMdu niyatajAga. 
\alnum{b} A jAgadalilxdudx goVlf AgadaMte ceMDanunx taDedu ADuva ATagAra yA avanu nilulxva jAga, sAthxna: \eng{full back} phulf bAYxkf. \eng{half back} hAphfbAYxkf. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} yAvudeV aMgada hiMBAga: \eng{back of the head} hiMdale; taleya hiMBAga. 
\num{9} (uDupina) benunx; BujagaLiMda soMTadavaregina BAga. 
\num{10} (kuciRya yA Asanada) benunx; benanxnunx oragisuva BAga. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{back of book} 
\banum
\alnum{a} pusatxkada benunx (paTiTx). 
\alnum{b} pusatxkada koneya puTagaLu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{back of ship} haDagina aDigaTuTx; iDiV haDagu yA doVNige AdhAravAda, taLaBAgadalilx hAsiruva mara yA kabibxNada dimimx. 
\num{3} \eng{the Backs} kAYxmf nadi tiVradalilxna keVMbirxjf kAleVjugaLa hiMdugaDeya AvaraNa, meYdAna. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{a pat on the back} utetxVjana; shahaBAsfgiri. 
\num{2} \eng{a stab in the back} beninxrita; naMbikedorxVha; vishAvxsaGAtakatana. 
\numi{3} \eng{at the back of} 
\banum
\alnum{a} beMbalavAgi; AdhAravAgi. 
\alnum{b} benanx hiMde; mareyalilx. 
\alnum{c} benanxTiTx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{4} \eng{at the back of one's mind} oLamanasisxnalilx; parxkaTavAgi yoVcisadidadxrU manasisxna yAvudoV mUleyalilx, BAgadalilx: \eng{with this at the back of his mind, he had volunteered to carry the news} idanunx oLamanasisxnalilx iTuTxkoMDu, avanu sudidxyanunx oyayxlu muMde baMdanu. 
\num{5} \eng{back and belly} hoTeTx baTeTx; hiTuTx baTeTx. 
\numi{6} \eng{back to back} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (manegaLu \mo vugaLa \vi) beninxge benAnxgi; yAvudeV eraDara benunxgaLu kUDikoMDu, muKagaLu virudadhxdikikxge tirugidaMte. 
\alnum{b} oMdara yA obabxra hiMde oMdu yA obabx; anukarxmavAgi; saraNiyalilx. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{7} \eng{be (flat) on one's back} 
\banum
\alnum{a} nisasxhAyanAgi bididxru. 
\alnum{b} aMgatatxnAgi bididxru. 
\hypertarget{back(1) 7c}{} 
\alnum{c} kAyile bididxru; hAsige hiDidiru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{behind one's back} guTATxgi; rahasayxvAgi. 
\num{9} \eng{be (thrown) on one's back} (kusitx \mo vugaLalilx) aMgatatxnAgi eseyalapxTuTx bididxru. 
\num{10} \eng{break one's back} benunx muriyuvaMte BAra heVru; ati BAravAda hore heVru; bahaLa kelasa koDu. 
\num{11} \eng{break someone's back} (yAranonxV) barigeY mADu; divALiyebibxsu. 
\numi{12} \eng{break the back of something} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (yAvudoV kelasada) ati kaSaTxda BAgavanunx mADi mugisu. 
\alnum{b} soVlisu; gelulx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{13} \eng{get off one's back} obabxna benunx biTuTx tolagu; (obabxnige) kirukuLa koDuvudanunx nililxsu: \eng{get off my back, I will have no more of you} ninanx sahavAsa inunx beVkilalx, tolagu nananx benunx biTuTx. 
\hypertarget{back(1) nuga(14)}{} 
\num{14} \eng{get one's back up} reVgisu; keraLisu; haTha hiDiyuvaMte, moMDAguvaMte mADu.

\num{13} (tUka yA parxmANada) hecacxLa; Adhikayx: \eng{the balance of advantage lies with him} anukUlada Adhikayx avana kaDegeV ide; avanigeV hecucx anukUlavide. 
\num{14} (jamAKacuR) Ayavayxyada -- silukx, sheVSa, vayxtAyxsa, aMtara. 
\num{15} (jamAKacuR) AyavayxyagaLa silukx teVlike; Ayavayxyada samajAyiSi. 
\num{16} (\AmA) (yAvudeV oMdara) uLike; silukx; sheVSa. 
\num{17} (jamAKacuR) bAki; uLike; tiVrisade uLidadudx. 
\num{18} (naqtayx) samavAda -- padavinAyxsa, hejejxyiDuvudu.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{balance due} bAki; koDabeVkAdudu. 
\num{2} \eng{balance in hand} keYsilukx; keYyalilx -- uLidadudx, niMtadudx; barabeVkAdudanenxlalx vasUlu mADi, koDabeVkAdudanenxlalx koTuTx uLida haNa. 
\num{3} \eng{balance of mind} samacitatxte; viveVka. 
\num{4} \eng{balance of nature} nisagaRda samatoVla; jiVvaMta vasutxgaLa parasapxra parxtikirxyegaLa pariNAmavAgi odaguva parisithxtigaLa sAthxyiV sithxti yA sAmayxsithxti. 
\num{5} \eng{balance of payments} saluvaLiya sheVSa; saMdAyada aMtara, vayxtAyxsa; pararASaTxrXgaLiMda salalxbeVkAgidadxkUkx, pararASaTxrXgaLige salilxsabeVkAdadadxkUkx iruva vayxtAyxsa. 
\numi{6} \eng{balance of power} balasaMtulana; shakitx samatoVla: 
\banum
\alnum{a} yAvudeV oMdu rASaTxrX itara rASaTxrXgaLigiMta baliSaThxvAgadaMte rASaTxrXgaLu hoMdiruva seYnika matutx AthiRka bala parasapxra samAnavAgiruvudu. 
\alnum{b} bahusaMKAyxtavagaRdoDane sahakarisuva mUlaka A vagaRkekx adhikAravanunx dorakisuva alapxsaMKAyxtavagaRda shakitx, bala. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} \eng{balance of trade} rASaTxrXvoMdara Amadu raPutxgaLa aMtara, vayxtAyxsa. 
\num{8} \eng{on balance} elalxvanUnx gaNanege tegedukoMDu; elalxvanUnx parishiVlisi; oTiTxna meVle; oTiTxnalilx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{hold the balance} niNaRyisuva yA niyaMtirxsuva adhikAra, shakitx hoMdiru. 
\num{2} \eng{hold the balance even} niSapxkaSxpAtadiMdiru; samAnavAgi vatiRsu. 
\num{3} \eng{in the balance} tUgADutatx; DoVlAyamAnavAgi; anishicxtavAgi; itayxthaRvAgade; saMdigadhx parisithxtiyalilx. 
\hyperdef{B}{balance(1) nuga(4)}{}

\alnum{b} (\rUpa) sethxYyaRdiMdiru; udivxganxnAgadiru; shAMtavAgiru. 
\hyperdef{B}{balance(1) nuga(5)}{} 
\eanum
\numie

\banum

\alnum{b} samacitatxteyanunx kaLeduko; udivxganxnAgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{6} \eng{off one's balance} 
\banum
\alnum{a} biVLuvaMte. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) samacitatxte kaLedukoMDu; udivxganxnAgi. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{7} \eng{strike a balance} 
\banum

\alnum{b} (\rUpa) elalxrigU nAyxyaveMdu kANuva parihAra yA rAjisUtarx kaMDuhiDi. 
\eanum
\numie

\bentry
\word[be(1)]{be}
\pron{biV, bi}
\gl{\kirx}
\bmng
(anidiRSaTx vataRmAnakAla) utatxma puruSa \Eva\ \eng{am;} (\pArxparx) (\eng{thou} jatege) madhayxmapuruSa \Eva\ \eng{art;} (Adhunika \parx\ \eng{you} jotege) madhayxma puruSa \Eva\ \eng{are;} parxthama puruSa \Eva\ \eng{is;} elalx puruSagaLa \bava\ \eng{are;} (\pArxparx) elalx puruSa, eraDu vacanagaLalUlx \eng{be: powers that be;} (anidiRSaTx BUtakAla) utatxma puruSa matutx parxthama puruSagaLa \Eva\ \eng{was;} (Adhunika \parx\ \eng{you} jatege) madhayxma puruSa \Eva\ \eng{were;} (\pArxparx) (\eng{thou} jotege) madhayxma puruSa \Eva\ \eng{wast;} saMBAvanA rUpa \eng{wert;} elalx puruSagaLa \bava\ \eng{were;} vataRmAna kAla saMBAvanAthaRka \eng{be;} BUtakAla saMBAvanAthaRka \eng{were;} vidhayxthaRka \eng{be;} \vakaq\ \eng{being;} \BUkaq\ \eng{been;} ADumAtina \saMkiSx\ rUpagaLu; \eng{'m = am;} \eng{'s = is;} \eng{'re = are; isn't, wasn't, aren't,} \bava\ \eng{weren't} ivu saMBASaNeya mAtu matutx baraha eraDaralUlx sAdhu; \eng{ain't} (\AmA) \eng{= am not; ain't} (\asaM\ yA \hA) \eng{= is not, are not.} 
\Li{R}
\numi{I} parxdhAna kirxyeyAgi:  
	\Li{A}
	\numi{A} (kelavomemx \eng{there} joteyalilx). 
		\bnum
		\num{1} iru: \eng{God is, there is a God} deVvaridAdxne. 
		\num{2} Agu; odagu; saMBavisu: \eng{when will the wedding be?} maduve yAvAga Agutatxde? \eng{peace be with you}! ninage shAMti odagali! 
		\num{3} badukiru; baduku; jiVvisu: \eng{to be or not to be} badukaloV, beVDavoV. 
		\num{4} idadxMte iru; irutAtx hoVgu: \eng{let it be} irali; adu hAgeyeV irali. \eng{do not be long} hotutx mADabeVDa; laMbisabeVDa. 
		\enum
	\numie	
	\numi{B} (\kirxvi\ yA \kirxvi da padagucaCxgaLoDane):
		\bnum
		\num{1} sathxLadalilx yA kAladalilx iru: \eng{is in the garden} toVTadalilx idAdxne. \eng{the holiday is on Monday} rajA soVmavArada dina. 
		\num{2} (oMdaratatx) hoVgu; sAgu: \eng{be off}! kUDaleV horaTu hoVgu! jAga biDu!: \eng{are you for Bangalore?} beMgaLUrige hoVgutitxdidxVyoV? \eng{is from Mysore} meYsUriniMda baMdava, baMdavaLu, baMdadudx.
		\num{3} sithxtiyalilx, avasethxyalilx -- iru; A sithxti anuBavisu: \eng{how is he?} avanu heVgidAdxne? avana sithxti heVgide? \eng{he is in debt} avanu sAladalilxdAdxne. 
		\num{4} kelasadalilx toDagi -- iru. \eng{what are you at or about?} niVnu yAvudaralilx toDagididxVye? niVnu Enu mADutitxdidxVye? \eng{are at play} ATavADutitxdAdxre. 
		\num{5} aBipArxya hoMdiru; daqSiTx taLediru: \eng{I am for tariff reform} nAnu suMkada sudhAraNeya aBipArxya hoMdidedxVne; nAnu suMkada sudhAraNeya paravAgidedxVne. 
		\enum
	\numie	
	\num{C} (kaqdaMtagaLoDane): (sathxLa \mo vugaLige) hoVgu: \eng{has been to Mangalore} maMgaLUrige hoVgidAdxne. \eng{has been into the matter} A viSaya noVDidAdxne, parishiVlisidAdxne. 
	\num{D} (\BUkaq) (\AmA) BeVTi -- mADida, itatx, niVDida; saMdashiRsida; baMdidadx: \eng{has anyone been?} yArAdarU baMdidadxre? BeVTi koTiTxdadxre? \eng{has not been for orders} apapxNe paDeyalubaMdilalx. 
	\num{E} (paroVkaSx kamaRpadadoDane) Agu; uMTAgu; saMBavisu; \eng{woe is me}! nanageMthA kaSaTx uMTAyitu! 
	\eLi
\numie	
\numi{II} saMyoVjaka \kirx vAgi: \nA, \gu\ yA \gu da padagucaCxgaLoDane. 
	\bnum
	\num{1} aMtiru; Agiru; A sithxtiyanunx yA guNavanunx hoMdiru: \eng{I am a man}nAnobabx manuSayx(nAgidedxVne). \eng{I am sick} nanage kAyile(Agide). \eng{I am of good courage} nanage  oLeLx dheYyaRvide. 
	\num{2} avaneV yA adeV Agiru: \eng{you are the man I want} nanage beVkAda vayxkitx niVneV (AgididxVye). \eng{it is I,} (\AmA) \eng{it is me} (adu) nAneV. 
	\num{3} motatxdalilx, oTuTx seVri, aSATxgu: \eng{twice two is four} eraDu eraDali nAlukx (Agutatxde). 
	\num{4} beleyAgu: \eng{what or how much are these mangoes?} I mAvina haNuNxgaLige Enu bele Agutatxde? 
	\num{5} parxdhAnavAda aMga yA aMsha Agu, Agiru: \eng{D.V.G. was the Gokhale Institute} goVKale inisxTXTUyxTf eMdare Di.vi.ji.yavareV (Agidadxru). 
	\num{6} pAtarx -- naTisu, aBinayisu, vahisu: \eng{Sir Laurence Olivier is Hamlet} sarf lArenfsx Aliviyarf hAYxmelxTf pAtarx vahisidAdxne. 
	\num{7} athaR -- hoMdiru, koDu, sUcisu, saMkeVtavAgiru: \eng{God is love} deVvaru eMdare perxVma. \eng{the seven lamp-stands are the seven churches} ELu diVpada kaMbagaLu ELu cacuRgaLa saMkeVta, ELu cacuRgaLanunx sUcisutatxve. 
	\num{8} bele hoMdiru; pArxmuKayx hoMdiru; saMbaMdhisiru: \eng{it is nothing to me} nananx baLi adakekx yAva beleyU ilalx; nanagU adakUkx yAva saMbaMdhavU ilalx.
	\enum
\numie	
\numi{III} sahAyaka \kirx vAgi: 
	\Li{1}
	\num{1} \sakirx gaLa \BUkaq\ gaLa saMgaDa \kaparx gaLanunx mADalu: \eng{this was done} idu mADalapxTiTxtu. 
	\num{2} (\pArxparx) \eng{fall, come, grow} \mo\ kelavu \akirx gaLa \BUkaq gaLa saMgaDa BUtakAladakirxyArUpagaLanunx mADalu: \eng{the sun  is set} sUyaR muLugidAdxne. \eng{Babylon is fallen} bAYxbilAnf hALu bididxde.

\bentry
\word[blow(1)]{blow}
\pron{bolxV}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{(\BU\ \eng{blew}, \BUkaq\ \eng{blown, blowed}.)}
\bmng
\akirx\ 
\bnum
\num{1} (gALiya \vi\ yA akataRqkavAgi) biVsu; tiVDu. 
\num{2} (bAyiyiMda) Udu; gALiyanunx -- biDu, horaDisu. 
\num{3} Edu; Edusiru biDu. 
\num{4} (gALi UdidudariMda) kUgu; shabadx, dani -- mADu: \eng{the siren blew} seYranf kUgitu. 
\num{5} (timiMgilagaLa \vi) (shAvxsa koVshadiMda) gALi matutx niVranunx -- cimumx, cimimxsu, horagese, horadUDu. 
\num{6} gALiyiMda -- hoDedukoMDu hoVgu, sAgu, sAgisalapxDu, oyayxlapxDu, dUDikoMDu yA taLiLxkoMDu hoVgu: \eng{her cap blew away} avaLa ToVpi gALiyalilx hoDedukoMDu hoVyitu. 
\num{7} (viduyxtitxna taMti yA PUyxsfzna \vi, mitimiVrida parxvAhadiMda) karagi, suTuTx -- hoVgu. 
\num{8} (gALi yA anila tuMbi balUnu \mo vu) Udu; ububx; doDaDxdAgu. 
\num{9} (noNagaLa \vi, yAvudoV oMdaralilx) moTeTxyiDu; tatitxhAku. 
\num{10} (AhArada Dababx, \mo vugaLa \vi, oLagaDeya anilada otatxDadiMda) siDi; soPxVTisu: \eng{the barrel of gunpowder blew up} madidxna piVpAyi siDiyitu. 
\num{11} (amerika matutx \AseTxrXV) (\AmA) jaMbahoDe; baDayikocucx: \eng{he kept blowing on his medals} tananx padakagaLa viSayavAgi avanu jaMbakocucxtatx idadx. 
\num{12} (\ashi) idadxkikxdadxMte horaDu; gADibiDu; jAga KAlimADu; horaTu naDe: \eng{let's blow} horaDoVNa. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (gALiya \vi) hoDedukoMDu, hotutxkoMDu, hArisikoMDu -- hoVgu, sAgisu: \eng{the wind blew the papers out of my hand} gALi nananx keYyiMda kAgadagaLanunx hArisikoMDu hoVyitu. 
\num{2} (AgaRnf vAdayxda) tidiyotutx; gALiciVlagaLanunx otutx. 
\num{3} (\kanmu\ \kaparx dalilx, \kanmu\ kudureyanunx) Edisu; EduvaMte mADu; parxyAsadiMda usirADuvaMte mADu. 
\num{4} bAyiyiMda (gALi, usiru, sigareVTina hoge, \mo vanunx) biDu, Udu, horaDisu. 
\num{5} (yAvudaradeV meVle, oLakekx yA mUlaka) gALi ya usiru -- Udu, urubu, biVsu, tuMbu, harisu: \eng{blow on one's fingers} (shAKa huTiTxkoLaLxlu) beraLugaLa mele Udu. \eng{blow fire} (hotitx uriyuvaMte mAdalu) beMki urubu. \eng{blow up a tire} TeYrinoLakekx gALi harisu yA tuMbu. \eng{blow a kiss} (pirxVti sUcisalu) keYge mutitxkikx dUradalilxruvavaratatx keYyanunx biVsu, ADisu. 
\num{6} (gALivAdayxvanunx, adara meVle yA mUlaka savxra yA saMkeVtavanunx) nuDisu; Udu; barisu; vAdisu; dhavxnisu. 
\num{7} (gALiyanunx) Udi -- (guLeLx) mADu, ebibxsu. 
\num{8} (gAjige) Udi -- AkAra koDu, rUpakoDu; Udi rUpisu. 
\num{9} siVdu; siVnu; usiru biTuTx mUganunx savxcaCxmADu. 
\num{10} (moTeTxyoLakekx gALiyanunx) Udi (oLagiruvudanunx) pUtiR surisibiDu yA KAlimADu. 
\num{11} siDisu; nAshagoLisu; cUru cUru mADu: \eng{a mine blew the ship to bits} soPxVTakavu haDaganunx cUrucUrAgi siDisitu. 
\num{12} siDisi oDeduhAku; siDitadiMda kabibxNada peTiTxge \mo vanunx muridu tege. 
\num{13} (viduyxtitxna mitimiVrida parxvAhadiMda phUyxsfz \mo vanunx) karagisu; karagi hoVguvaMte mADu. 
\num{14} (noNagaLa \vi) tatitxyiDu; moTeTxyiDu. 
\num{15} (\ashi) parxkaTisu; guTuTx -- raTuTx mADu, horageDavu. 
\num{16} (\ashi) hALAgu; nAshavAgu; negedubiVLu; hALAgihoVgu; keDu: \eng{I'll be blowed if that does not happen} adu saMBavisadidadxre nAnu hALAde. \eng{blow you, Rama} rAma, hALAgihoVgu. \eng{Oh blow}! (AshacxyaR yA koVpa sUcisuva udAgxravAgi) hALAga! 
\num{17} (\ashi) (haNa) poVlumADu; duMduvecacxmADu; duvaRyxya mADu; lekakxpakakxvilalxde -- KacuRmADu. kaLe: \eng{blow the expense} KaciRna bagegx ciMtisabeVDa. 
\num{18} (\ashi) keDisu; hALumADu; ayashasivxyAgu: \eng{we had our chance and blew it} namage avakAsha sikikxtutx, Adare adanunx hALumADikoMDevu. 
\num{19} (\ashi) (sathxLa, Uru, \mo vanunx) biDu; biTuTx -- hoVgu, tolagu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{blow off steam} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (eMjinf \mo vugaLiMda) hecicxna Aviyanunx horaDisi biDu dUDibiDu. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) kUgADu; Erida daniyalilx yA bahaLa hotutx kUgADuvudara mUlaka adumiTaTx yA mitimiVrida shakitx, koVpa, \mo\ BAvagaLanunx horageDavu yA horadUDi kaLeduko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{blow one's nose} siVdu; siVnu. 
\numi{3} \eng{blow over} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (birugALiya \vi) baDiyade yA biVsade -- shAMtavAgu, horaTuhoVgu. 
\alnum{b} (birumoVDada \vi) maLe surisade teVlihoVgu. 
\alnum{c} (duviRdhi, viSama parisithxti \mo vu.) kaLeduhoVgu; hAnimADade mugi. 
\alnum{d} (koVpa \mo vu) iLi; shAMtavAgu; shamanavAgu; taNaNxgAgu; samAdhAnavAgu: \eng{his anger soon blew over} avana koVpa beVga shAMtavAyitu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{4} \eng{blow up} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (TeYru, balUnu, \mo vugaLa \vi) ubibxsu; (gALi) Udi ubibxsu; gALi yA anila tuMbu. 
\alnum{b} siDisi -- hArisu yA cUru mADu. 
\alnum{c} bayuyx; KaMDisu; dUSisu; AkeSxVpisu; tarATege tegeduko; CiVmAri hAku. 
\alnum{d} (\AmA) (nakeSx yA citarxvanunx) higigxsu; vadhiRsu; visatxrisu; doDaDxdu mADu. 
\alnum{e} (GaTane, vadaMti, \mo vanunx) hecucxmADu; atishayisu; hecucxmADi -- toVrisu, vaNiRsu: \eng{he blew up his own role in the war} avanu yudadhxdalilxna tananx pAtarxvanunx hecucx mADi vaNiRsida. 
\alnum{f} ELu; uMTAgu; utapxtitxyAgu; saMBavisu. 
\alnum{g} kANisiko; goVcaravAgu; daqSiTxge yA gamanakekx baru. 
\alnum{h} siDidu -- cUrucUrAgu, oDe. 
\alnum{i} keraLu; reVgu; siTATxgu; tALemx yA sahane kaLedukU. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{blow down} 
\banum
\alnum{a} biVsi keDavu. 
\alnum{b} (yaMtarxgaLa \vi) kelasa -- nililxsu, sathxgitagoLisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{blow great guns} (caMDamArutada \vi) birusAgi, raBasadiMda, parxbalavAgi -- biVsu. 
\num{3} \eng{blow high, blow low} EneV Agali yA saMBavisali. 
\hyperdef{B}{blow(1) nuga(4)}{} 
\num{4} \eng{blow hot and cold} tUgADu; hoyAdxDu; DoVlAyamAnavAgiru; niSakxSeRyilalxdiru; oMdu kaSxNa anukUlavAgi marukaSxNa parxtikUlavAgi nuDi, naDe. 
\numi{5} \eng{blow in} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (\AmA) idadxkikxdadxMte, EkAEki, haThAtAtxgi -- baru, baMdu seVru: \eng{he blew in on us of a sudden} avanu EkAEki namage BeVTikoTaTx. 
\alnum{b} (\ashi) (tananx haNavanenxlalx) poVlu, duMdu -- mADu; duvaRyxya mADu. 
\alnum{c} oLakekx siDisu; oLagaDege hoVguvaMte siDisu yA siDisi oDe. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{6} \eng{blow on upon} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (vayxkitxya) hesaru keDisu; (vayxkitxge) keTaTxhesaru, apakiVtiR, kaLaMka -- taru: \eng{his reputation has been blown upon} avana hesaranunx keDisalAgide. 
\alnum{b} haLasalu mADu; hosatanavanunx, kAMtiyanunx -- kaLe, kuMdisu: \eng{the story is not yet blown upon} I kate inUnx haLasilalx. 
\hyperdef{B}{blow(1) nuga(7)}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} \eng{blow one's own trumpet} tananxnunx tAneV hogaLiko; baDAyi, jaMba -- kocicxko; Atamx parxshaMse, AtamxshAlxGane -- mADiko; tananx kahaLe yA tutUtxriyanunx tAneV Udiko. 
\numi{8} \eng{blow out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (beMkiyanunx yA jAvxleyanunx) naMdisu; Arisu. 
\alnum{b} (beMki yA jAvxle gALiyiMda) naMdu; ArihoVgu. 
\alnum{c} siDisi hArisu; horakekx siDisu. 
\alnum{d} (cakarxda TeYrina \vi) oDeduhoVgu; visoPxVTisu. 
\alnum{e} (viduyxtitxna phUyxsfZ \mo vugaLa \vi) karagi, Uridu, suTuTx -- hoVgu. 
\alnum{f} (birugALi, maLeya \vi) savxlapx hotitxna baLika shAMtavAgu 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} \eng{blow one's mind} (\ashi) hagaluganasu kANuvaMte, BarxmegaLalilx viharisuvaMte -- mADu. 
\num{10} \eng{blow one's stack} (\ame) = \hyperlink{blow(1)nuga(12)}{?nuga? \((12)\)}.

\bentry

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (pUNaRvasutxvina \vi) oDe; oDedu hAku; muri; muridu hAku. 
\num{2} (eraDu yA hecucx) BAgagaLAgi yA cUrugaLAgi mADu. 
\num{3} (tale, camaR, kuru, rakatxnALa, \mo vanunx) oDe; siVLu: \eng{break a head} taleyanunx oDedu hAku. 
\num{4} cUrucUru mADu; nucucxnUrAgisu: \eng{break a window} kiTakiyanunx cUrucUru mADu. 
\num{5} (benunx, kAlu, keY, \mo\ deVhada BAgagaLanunx) muri; muriduhAku: \eng{break the leg} kAlanunx muriduhAku. 
\num{6} (aDiDxgaLanunx) BeVdisi sarisi (dAri \mo vanunx) mADikoMDu hoVgu: \eng{break a way thro' the crowd} guMpanunx BeVdisikoMDu hoVgu. 
\num{7} kore: \eng{break a hole in the ice} himarAshiyalilx raMdharx kore. 
\num{8} (katatxleya \vi) mugisu; konegANisu; harisu: \eng{break gloom} katatxle harisu. 
\num{9} (moVDi, maMtarxda \vi) (kaTuTx) biDisu; biVrida maMtarxda parxBAvavanunx tegeduhAku: \eng{break the spell} moVDi biDisu. 
\num{10} (parxyANavanunx, upavAsavanunx naDuve) nililxsu; mugisu. 
\num{11} (mwnavanunx) muri; BaMgagoLisu; katatxrisi, kaDidu -- hAku. 
\num{13} (saMkeVta, lipi, BASe, \mo vanunx) BeVdisu; athaR mADu: \eng{break a cipher} saMkeVtavanunx BeVdisu. 
\num{14} (vasutxvina BAgavanunx) muri; beVpaRDisu; parxteyxVkisu: \eng{break a bough from the tree} maradiMda koMbeyanunx muri. 
\num{15} (vayxkitxyiMda avana lakaSxNavanunx yA aBAyxsavanunx) biDisu: \eng{break person of habit} manuSayxnanunx avana aBAyxsadiMda biDisu. 
\num{16} (mane \mo vugaLanunx yA \mo vugaLige) balaparxyoVgadiMda BeVdisikoMDu hoVgu, oDedu nugugx: \eng{break into house} maneyanunx BeVdisikoMDu oLa nugugx. \eng{break out of prison} seremaneyanunx BeVdisikoMDu horakekx hoVgu. 
\num{17} (seremane, elelxkaTuTx yA maregaLiMda) tapipxsiko; hora horaDu. 
\num{18} bala -- tagigxsu, kugigxsu, kaDame mADu, shithilagoLisu: \eng{break blow} ETina bala tagigxsu. \eng{break fall} patanada peTaTxnunx kaDimegoLisu. 
\num{19} (kecucx, utAsxha, shakitx, \mo vanunx) kugigxsu; iLisu; muri. 
\num{20} oDe; hALu mADu; nAshamADu; hAnimADu; keDisu; kelasamADadaMte mADu: \eng{break the clock} gaDiyAravanunx keDisu. 
\num{21} muLugisu; divALi mADu: \eng{break bank} bAyxMkanunx muLugisu. 
\num{22} paLagisu; sAdhugoLisu; aMkege taru: \eng{break a horse (to the rein)} kudureyanunx (kaDivANakekx) paLagisu. \eng{break a child} tuMTamaguvanunx aMkege taru. 
\num{23} aDagisu; nigarxhisu; damanamADu; sAvxdhiVnakekx tegeduko: \eng{break one's will} haTavanunx aDagisu. \eng{break a rebellion} daMgeyanunx aDagisu. 
\num{24} (shAsana, kAnUnu, opapxMda, vAgAdxna, \mo vanunx) muri; BaMgamADu; ulalxMGisu: \eng{break a promise} vAgAdxna muri. \eng{break the law} kAnUnu muri; shAsanaBaMgamADu. 
\num{25} (bele, motatx, \mo vanunx) viMgaDisu; vivarisu: \eng{break up the total expenditure into several items} oTuTx vecacxvanunx viMgaDisi adara vividha aMshagaLanunx vivarisu. 
\num{26} (viduyxnamxMDalavanunx) kaDi; saMpakaRvanunx tege; viduyxtf hariyuvudanunx nililxsu. 
\num{27} (dhavani) (savxravanunx) oDe; saMyukatxsavxravAgisu; saMyukatxsavxravanAnxgi mADu: \eng{the consonant l, breaks the foregoing a into ea} vayxMjana \eng{1} tananx muMdina \eng{a} anunx \eng{ea} Agi oDeyutatxde. 
\num{28} (katatxnunx) muri yA kiVlu tapipxsu. 
\num{29} (dAKale \mo vanunx) muri; miVrisu: \eng{he broke the record for high jump} etatxra negetada dAKaleyanunx avanu murida, miVrisida. 
\num{30} (bAyxMkf noVTu \mo vanunx) murisu; nANayxgaLanAnxgi parivatiRsu. 
\num{31} (\nw) (dhavxja \mo vanunx, saDilavAgi hAkiruva gaMTanunx eLedu) bicucx; haraDu; tere. 
\num{32} (saMpu, caLavaLigaLanunx) muri; avugaLa udedxVshavanunx vayxthaRgoLisu. 
\num{33} (aparAdhi heVLuva nevavanunx) suLeLxMdu, tapepxMdu -- sAdhisu, toVrisu. 
\num{34} (Tenisf \mo\ ATagaLalilx, edurALiyu saviRsf mADuvAga) ATavanunx gelulx. 
\num{35} (adhikAriyanunx kelasadiMda) vajAmADu; tegeduhAku. 
\num{36} (sudidxyanunx) horageDavu; horapaDisu; parxkaTisu. 
\num{37} (rajavanunx baLasikoMDAda meVlU) nwkAseVvege -- hAjarAgadiru, hiMdirugadiru, kelasakekx barade uLiduko: \eng{he broke the ship} avanu (rajeyanunx baLasikoMDAda meVlU) nwkeya kelasakekx baralilalx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} oDe; oDeduhoVgu; viBAgavAgu; cUrucUrAgu; muri; muriduhoVgu. 
\num{2} (tale, camaR, kuru, rakatxnALa, \mo vugaLa \vi) oDe; oDetu hoVgu; biri; siVLu: \eng{abscess breaks} kuru oDeyutatxde. 
\num{3} (deVhada BAgagaLa \vi) muri; muriduhoVgu. 
\num{4} kore; koredukoMDu hoVgu. 
\num{5} (dhavxniya yA gaMTalina \vi, ywvanadiMda yA BAvoVdevxVgadiMda) oDe; badalAgu. 
\num{6} (saMbaMdha \mo vugaLu) oDe; muri; BaMgavAgu; katatxrisi, kaDidu -- hoVgu. 
\num{7} (muSiTxkALagada malalxra \vi, \sA\ rephariya AjecnxyiMda) parasapxra -- beVpaRDu, beVrAgu; parasapxra tekekxyiMda biTuTxbaru. 
\num{8} dubaRlavAgu; bala -- kugugx, tagugx. 
\num{9} hALAgu; keTuTxhoVgu; nAshavAgu. 
\num{10} muLuguhoVgu; divALiyAgu; \eng{merchant breaks} vataRkanu divALiyAgutAtxne. 
\num{11} (Qutu \mo vu) niMtuhoVgu; mugiduhoVgu: \eng{frost breaks} himagAla mugiyutatxde. 
\num{12} (alegaLa \vi) hiMduruLi -- noreyAgi hoVgu, oDedu hoVgu, cUrucUrAgu. 
\num{13} (belegaLa \vi) kusi; idadxkikxdadxMte -- bidudxhoVgu, iLidu hoVgu. 
\num{14} (havAmAnada \vi, \kanmu\ nidiRSaTx havAmAnada madhayxdalilx) idadxkikxdadxMte -- badalAgu, vayxtAyxsavAgu. 
\num{15} (seYnayxda paDegaLa \vi) gAbariyiMda, kaMgeTuTx -- cedurihoVgu, dikAkxpAlAgu. 
\num{16} (moVDagaLa \vi) oDe; biruku yA saMdu -- biDu; cadurihoVgu. 
\num{17} (\dhavxni) (savxrada \vi) oDeduhoVgu; saMyukatxsavxravAgu. 
\num{18} (kelasada madhayxdalilx) biDuvu paDe; virAma tegeduko; visharxmisu: \eng{we broke for coffee} nAvu kAphigAgi biDuvu tegedukoMDevu. 
\num{19} (kirxkeTfnalilx boVlf mADida ceMDina \vi) nelakekx taguli puTa egarida meVle -- modalina dikakxnunx badalAyisu, beVre dikikxge horaLu. 
\num{20} (dinada \vi) beLagAgu; beLaku hari; aruNoVdayavAgu. 
\num{21} (birugALiya \vi) birusAgi, ugarxvAgi, joVrAgi -- pArxraMBavAgu, shuruvAgu. 
\num{22} (sudidxya \vi) bahiraMgavAgu; parxkaTavAgu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1}\eng{break a set} (yaMtarx \mo vugaLa \vi) biDiBAgagaLanunx yA BAgagaLanunx -- biDibiDiyAgi mAru. 
\numi{2} \eng{break away} 
\banum
\alnum{a} beVpaRDisu; savxtaMtarxvAgisu; parxteyxVkisu. 
\alnum{b} beVpaRDu; beVrAgu; parxteyxVkavAgu; savxtaMtarxvAgu. 
\alnum{c} tapipxsikoMDu, biDisikoMDu -- hoVgu; ODi hoVgu; parAriyAgu; idadxkikxdadxMte yA haThAtAtxgi -- ODi biDu, horaTuhoVgu. 
\alnum{d} (aBAyxsa, aBipArxya, AloVcanA padadhxti \mo vanunx) tore; biTuTxbiDi; tayxjisu: \eng{break away from old habits} haLeya padadhxtigaLanunx biTuTxbiDu. \eng{about 20 members have broken away from the party} sumAru \eng{20} sadasayxru pakaSxvanunx tayxjisidAdxre. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} \eng{break free} = \hyperlink{break(1)pagu(5)}{?pagu? \((5)\)} 
\hyperdef{B}{break(1) pagu(4)}{} 
\numi{4} \eng{break ground} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (jamiVnanunx) uLu. 
\alnum{b} mutitxgeyanunx AraMBisu. 
\alnum{c} kelasa shuru hacucx; kAyARraMBamADu.

\eanum
\numie
\numi{5} \eng{break loose} 
\banum

\alnum{b} sAlanunx biTuTx ODu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{break news} sudidxyanunx -- horageDahu, parxkaTisu. 
\numi{7} \eng{break off} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (kaTuTx \mo vugaLa \vi) kaDidu beVpaRDisu; kaDiduhoVgu. 
\alnum{b} (yAvudeV kelasada \vi) idadxkikxdadxMte -- nililxsu, konegANisu, konegANu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{break one's word} koTaTx mAtige tapupx; BASe tapupx; vAgAdxnavanunx muri. 
\num{9} \eng{break a piece off} (vasutxviniMda) BAgavanunx kitutxhAku. 
\num{10} \eng{break step} (sAlinalilx hoVguvAga) hejejx tapupx; tapupx hejejx hAku. 
\enum

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} suDu; suTuTx -- biDu, hAku; dahisibiDu; suTuTx -- bUdimADu, BasamxmADu. 
\num{2} (diVpa, eNeNx, anila, \mo vanunx) urisu; hotitxsu; beLagisu; beLaguvaMte yA parxkAshisuvaMte mADu. 
\num{3} (vayxkitxyanunx) suTuTxkolulx; dahisi sAyisu. 
\num{4} (jeVDimaNuNx, suNaNxda kalulx, \mo vanunx nidiRSaTx udedxVshakAkxgi) suDu. 
\num{5} (suNaNxkalalxnunx) suDu; suTuTx suNaNx tayArisu. 
\num{6} (iTiTxge, maDake, \mo vanunx) suDu; suTuTx -- gaTiTxgoLisu yA merugu koDu. 
\num{7} (kaTiTxgeyanunx) suTuTx ididxlu tayArisu. 
\num{8} (beMki, tiVvarxshAKa, \mo vugaLa \vi) suTuTx gAyagoLisu; suDugAyavanunxMTumADu. 
\num{9} suDuva mUlaka (tUtu, \mo vanunx) mADu. 
\num{10} (aDugeyalilx) siVyisu; karikAguvaMte mADu. 
\num{11} (aDugeyalilx) aDihatitxsu; taLahotitxsu. 
\num{12} (cikitesxyalilx, Amalx \mo\ dAhadiMda yA kAsida kabibxNadiMda) suTuTxbiDu; barehAku. 
\num{13} (Amalx \mo vugaLa \vi) suTuTx -- tiMduhAku, dahisihAku. 
\num{14} (Amalx \mo vu) suTuTxhAkuvaMte, dahisuvaMte -- mADu; (Amalx \mo vugaLiMda) suDisu. 
\num{15} (bisilina \vi) (peYrupacecx, kere, \mo vanunx) oNagisu; batitxsu. 
\num{16} (bisilu yA beMkiya \vi) suTuTx kalegaLanunx yA macecxgaLanunx -- uMTumADu. 
\num{17} (bisilu yA beMkiya \vi) kaMdisu; kaMdubaNaNxkekx tirugisu. 
\num{18} (\rUpa\ saha) suDuvaMtAgisu; bisi tAgisu; kAvu muTiTxsu; uriyuvaMte mADu: uri uMTumADu; suDuvikeya -- anuBava yA noVvanunx uMTumADu: \eng{the soup burns the throat} huLi gaMTalanunx suDutatxde. 
\num{19} reVgisu; keraLisu; korxVdhavanunxMTumADu. 
\num{20} (yureVniyaM, heYDorxjanf, \mo vugaLanunx) urisu; dahisu; vidaLisi yA samimxLisi upayoVgisu: \eng{hundred grammes of uranium were burnt in this reactor} I riyAkaTxrinalilx nUru gArxmf yureVniyamamxnunx dahisalAyitu. \eng{hydrogen is burnt to helium} heYDirxjananxnunx suTuTx (samimxLisi) hiVliyamamxnunx tayArisalAyitu. 
\num{21} BAvoVderxVkagoLisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} suTuTx, dahisi -- hoVgu; suTuTx -- BasamxvAgu, bUdiyAgu. 
\num{2} (beMkiya \vi) uri; javxlisu. 
\num{3} (diVpa, eNeNx, \mo vugaLa \vi) uri; beLagu; parxkAshisu. 
\num{4} (vayxkitxya \vi) suTuTxsAyu. 
\num{5} (beMki yA tiVvarx shAKadiMda) suTaTxgAyavAgu. 
\num{6} (aDugeyalilx) siVduhoVgu; karikAgu; taLahotutx. 
\num{7} (Amalx \mo vugaLa \vi) tiMdu, suTuTx -- hAku. 
\num{8} (bisiliniMda peYrupacecx, kere, \mo vu) oNagi, batitx -- hoVgu. 
\num{9} (bisilu yA beMkiyiMda) suTaTx -- kalegaLAgu, macecxgaLAgu. 
\num{10} (\rUpa\ saha) suDu; uri; bisitAgu; suDuvikeya anuBava yA noVvu uMTAgu. 
\num{11} (beMki yA tiVvarxshAKadiMda) suDuvaMtiru; kAyidxru; tapatxvAgiru. 
\num{12} (BAvagaLa \vi) reVgu; keraLu; uri; javxlisu; udirxkatxvAgiru; AveVshadiMda tuMbiru. 
\num{13} (perxVma, haMbala, \mo vugaLiMda) tavakisu; tavakapaDu; haMbalisu; hAtore. 
\num{14} (yureVniyaM yA heYDorxjanf) suTuTx, dahisi -- hoVgu; dahanavAgu; vidaLanavAgu yA samimxLanagoLuLx: \eng{uranium burns by absorbing neutrons} nUyxTArxnugaLanunx hiVrikoMDu yureVniyaM dahisutatxde. \eng{hydrogen burns to form helium} heYDorxjanf suTuTx (samimxLana hoMdi) hiVliyaM Agutatxde. 
\num{15} (\ashi) veVgavAgi vAhana naDesu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{burn away} 
\banum
\alnum{a} uriyutitxru: \eng{the light was burning away all night} rAtirxyelalx diVpa uriyutitxtutx. 
\alnum{b} suTuTx, uridu, dahisi -- hoVgu; uriyutitxruvudara mUlaka yA iMdhana KacARgi kaDameyAgu yA pUtiR nAshavAgu: \eng{half the candle had burnt away} adhaR moVMbatitx uriduhoVgitutx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{burn blue} niVlibaNaNxdalilx, niVliyAgi -- uri. 
\numi{3} \eng{burn down} 
\hypertarget{burn(2) pagu(3a)}{} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (iMdhana kaDameyAdaMte) tagigx, melalxge -- uri; uri kaDameyAgu. 
\alnum{b} (kaTaTxDa \mo vanunx) suTuTxhAkibiDu; pUtiR BasamxgoLisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{4} \eng{burn low} = \hyperlink{burn(2) pagu(3a)}{?pagu? \((3a)\)}. 
\num{5} \eng{burn metals together} loVhagaLanunx bese. 
\num{6} \eng{burn oneself out} vipariVta kelasadiMda yA atiyAda BoVgadiMda -- nitArxNanAgu, baLalihoVgu, nishayxkatxnAgu. 
\numi{7} \eng{burn out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} \pagu (\eng{1}). 
\alnum{b} uriduhoVguva mUlaka -- niSikxrXyavAgu yA niSikxrXyagoLisu; suTuTxhoVgi -- kelasamADadAgu yA kelasa mADadaMte mADu. 
\alnum{c} (yAvudaradeV GaTakAMshagaLanunx) suTuTxhAku; dahisibiDu. 
\alnum{d} (\rUpa\ saha) beMkiyiMda mane, maTha, vAyxpAra, \mo vanunx -- suTuTxhAkibiDu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{burn person out} manege beMkiyiTuTx yA obabxna vAyxpAra \mo vanunx nAshamADi vayxkitxyanunx -- ODisi biDu, aTiTxbiDu: \eng{I was burnt out of house and home} nananx manemaTha elalxvanUnx suTuTx nananxnunx ODisibiTaTxru. 
\numi{9} \eng{burn up} 
\banum
\alnum{a} suTuTx dhavxMsamADu, BasamxmADu, nAshamADu. 
\alnum{b} uriyeVLu; jAvxleyeVLu. 
\alnum{c} (\ame) (\ashi) siTATxgu yA siTuTx barisu; reVgu yA reVgisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{burn} \hyperref{kandict_c.pdf}{C}{candle(1) nuga(2)}{$^1$candle at both ends}. 
\num{2} \eng{burn daylight} hagalinalilx paMju urisu; kelasabiTuTx kADuharaTeyalilx kAla kaLe. 
\hypertarget{burn(2)nuga(3)}{} 
\numi{3} \eng{burn in} 
\banum
\alnum{a} oMdu viSayavanunx obabxna manasisxnalilx acacxLiyadaMte muderx otutx. 
\alnum{b} oMdu viSaya obabxna manasisxnalilx acacxLiyadaMte mudirxtavAgu. 
\alnum{c} suDumuderxyotutx; suDuva yA tApada mUlaka acocxtutx; tapAtxMkana mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{4} \eng{burn into} = \hyperlink{burn(2)nuga(3)}{?nuga? \((3)\)}. 
\hypertarget{burn(2) nuga(5)}{} 
\num{5} \eng{burn one's boats} hiMdaDiyiDalAgade Agu; himemxTaTxlAgada hejejxyiTuTx himemxTuTxva avakAshavanunx kaLeduko; badalAyisalAgada kelasamADi badalAyisalAradaMte mADiko. 
\hypertarget{burn(2) nuga(6)}{}

\num{1} (oLagina vasutxgaLa higagxlike yA AMtarika otatxDadiMda koVsha \mo vu). siDi; siDidu cUrAgu; soPxVTisu.

\num{3} (utAsxha, BAvoVdevxVga, \mo vugaLiMda) biri; oDe; biriyuvaMtiru: \eng{heart burst} ede oDeyutatxde. 
\num{4} (raBasavAgi yA haThAtAtxgi, idadxkikxdadxMte, EkAEki -- horakekx yA oLakekx) nugugx: \eng{he burst into the room} avanu idadxkikxdadxMte rUminoLakekx nugigxda. 
\num{5} (mogugx, muguLu) biri; araLu. 
\num{6} (niVguRLeLx, kuru) oDe; biri; soPxVTisu. 
\num{7} (moVDa) birumaLe surisi cedurihoVgu. 
\num{8} (raBasadiMda) tereduko: \eng{door bursts open} bAgilu daDArane teredukoMDitu. 
\num{9} tuMbiru; BatiRyAgiru; tuMbi -- tuLuku, biri; biriduhoVguvaSuTx BatiRyAgiru: \eng{the granary is bursting with grain} kaNaja dhAnayxdiMda tuMbi tuLukutitxde. \eng{he is bursting with pride} ahaMkAradiMda biVgi biriyutitxdAdxne. 
\num{10} (koVpadiMda) siDi; siDidubiVLu. 
\num{11} haThAtatxne, EkAEki -- baru, kANisiko, goVcaravAgu: \eng{he burst upon the assembly} avanu saBeyalilx EkAEki kANisikoMDa. 
\num{12} (haThAtatxne yA tiVvarxvAgi BAvagaLanunx) parxkaTisu; parxdashiRsu: \eng{burst into laughter} haThAtatxne nagalu pArxraMBisu. \eng{burst into tears} idadxkikxdadxMte joVrAgi kaNiNxVru surisi aLu. \eng{burst into a tirade} EkAEki KaMDisalu toDagu.

\noindent

\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (koVshavanunx) siDisu; soPxVTisu; siDiduhoVguvaMte mADu. 
\num{2} oDedu, BeVdisikoMDu -- nugugx: \eng{river bursts the banks} nadiyu daDavanunx BeVdisikoMDu nugugxtatxde. 
\num{3} (mogagxnunx, muguLanunx, gALi \mo vu) biriyisu; araLisu.

\alnum{b} idadxkikxdadxMte -- shuruvAgu, pArxraMBisu: \eng{burst out laughing} pakakxne nagatoDagu. 
\alnum{c} (yudadhx, roVga, galaBe, \mo vugaLa \vi) haThAtAtxgi -- taledoVru, uMTAgu, kANisiko; goVcaravAgu.

\bentry
\word[buy(1)]{buy}
\pron{beY}
\gl{\sakirx}
\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{bought} \ucAcx\ bATf). }
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (belekoTuTx) koLuLx; koMDuko; karxyakekx paDe; KariVdimADu. 
\num{2} (sarakugaLanunx) odagisikoLaLxlu, paDedukoLaLxlu -- sAdhanavAgu, mAdhayxmavAgi vatiRsu: \eng{money cannot buy happiness} saMtoVSavanunx paDeyalu haNa sAdhanavAgalAradu; haNa saMtoVSavanunx koLaLxlAradu. 
\num{3} (yAvudanenxV) koTuTx, tAyxgamADi -- paDe, gaLisu, ajiRsu, saMpAdisu: \eng{freedom is a thing dearly bought} sAvxtaMtarxyXveMbudu apAra tAyxgadiMda ajiRsida vasutx. \eng{buy favour with flattery} hogaLi anugarxha paDe. 
\num{4} (laMca \mo vanunx koTuTx, adhikAradalilxruva vayxkitx \mo varanunx) koMDuko; vashapaDisiko; olisiko. 
\num{5} (\ashi) opupx; opipxko; naMbu: \eng{if the work is perfect the inspector buys it} kelasa sariyAgidadxre infsepxkaTxrf opipxkoLuLxtAtxne. 
\num{6} (\ashi) moVsahoVgu: \eng{he bought the whole story} avanu iDiV kateyiMda moVsahoVda. 
\num{7} (\ashi) hAnigoLagAgu; naSaTxkokxLagAgu. 
\num{8} (\ashi) shikeSxpaDe; shikeSx anuBavisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{buy a pig in a poke} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (vasutxvanunx guNapaTaTx pariVkiSxsade koMDukoMDu) odAdxDu. 
\alnum{b} hiMdumuMdu noVDade mAtukoTuTx sikikxhAkiko. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} \eng{buy in} 
\banum
\alnum{a} sarakugaLanunx oTuTxgaTaTxle koMDu -- dAsAtxnu mADu, saMgarxhisiDu. 
\alnum{b} (mAlikana yA avana kaDeyavana \vi) harAjinalilx itarara savAlugaLu mAlina belegiMta kaDameyidAdxga, tAneV avugaLigiMta hecicxna savAlu bele kUgi, mAlanunx punaH koMDuko; matetx paDeduko. 
\alnum{c} = \hyperlink{buy(1)nuga(3)}{?nuga? \((3)\)}. 
\hypertarget{buy(1)nuga(3)}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} \eng{buy into} (yAvudeV kaMpaniyalilx) pAludArike yA BAga koMDuko. 
\num{4} \eng{buy it} sAyi; sAvige tutAtxgu: \eng{he bought it at the front} avanu yudadhxraMgadalilx satatx. 
\numi{5} \eng{buy off} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (hakukxdAranige) haNa salilxsi (yAvudeV Asitxya) hakakxnunx koMDuko. 
\alnum{b} (suligekoVrana hiMse tapipxsikoLaLxlu) daMDa tetutx (avaniMda) pArAgu. 
\alnum{c} (savxMta iceCxyiMdaloV balAtAkxradiMdaloV seYnayxkekx seVridavananunx biDisikoLaLxlu) parihArashulakx tetutx (seYnayxdiMda avananunx) -- biDisiko, vimoVcanegoLisu. 
\hypertarget{buy(1)nuga(5d)}{} 
\alnum{d} laMcakoTuTx -- olisiko, keYvashapaDisiko, koMDuko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{buy oneself out} haNa tetutx (baMdhana, karAru, \mo vugaLiMda) biDisiko. 
\numi{7} \eng{buy out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (hudedx, Asitx, \mo vanunx tanagAgi biTuTxkoDalu adakekx saMbaMdhisida vayxkitxge) haNa tetutx (adanunx) koMDuko. 
\alnum{b} (iDiV dAsAtxnu, SeVrugaLu, vAyxpArada hakukx \mo) elalxvanUnx koMDubiDu; savaRsavxvanUnx koMDuko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{buy over} = \hyperlink{buy(1)nuga(5d)}{?nuga? \((5d)\)}. 
\numi{9} \eng{buy up} 
\banum
\alnum{a} elalxvanUnx yA siguvaSaTxnUnx koMDukoMDu biDu: \eng{he bought up the whole lot} avanu A sarakaSaTxnUnx koMDukoMDubiTaTx. 
\alnum{b} (beVrobabxna jamiVnu, vANijayxsaMsethx, \mo vanunx tananxdaroDane, seVrisikoLaLxlu) koMDuko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} \eng{I'll buy it} (\ashi) (muMdiTaTx ogaTige yA samaseyxge utatxravAgi) nanage tiLiyadu, niVnu heVLidadxnenxV opipxkoLuLxtetxVne. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\bentry

\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} baLi; hatitxra; baLiya; hatitxrada; pakakxda; magugxlina: \eng{Ilwala by Mysore} meYsUrina pakakxda ilAvxla gArxma. 
\num{2} baLi(ge); hatitxra(kekx); pakakx(kekx) samiVpa(kekx): \eng{come here by me} ililx bA nananx hatitxra. 
\num{3} parxdeVshada; valayada; keSxVtarxda. 
\num{4} baLi; hatitxra: \eng{have not got it by me} adu nananx hatitxra ilalx. 
\num{5} oDane; saMgaDa; jotege; sahita; sameVta: \eng{send the cheque by bearer} kAgadavanunx taruvavanoDane cekakxnunx kaLuhisi. 
\num{6} (dikukxgaLa \vi) kaDege; savxlapx Oli: \eng{North by East} utatxradiMda IshAnayxda kaDege; utatxrakUkx utatxra IshAnayxkUkx naDuve. 
\num{7} pakakxkekx; hatitxra; baLi; samiVpa: \eng{by the stern} haDagina hiMBAgada -- pakakxkekx, hatitxra. 
\num{8} mUlaka; muKeVna; muKAMtara; mAgaRvAgi; dAvxrA: \eng{by nearest road} ati hatitxrada dAriya mUlaka. \eng{by land and sea} BUmi matutx samudarxda mUlaka. 
\num{9} (obabxnanunx, oMdu sathxLavanunx) dATi; miVri; hAyudx; atikarxmisi: \eng{pass by him} avananunx dATi muMde hoVgu.
